bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie B. Lawrence, October 4, 1875

div1.p: Reed's visit to Emilie Lawrence is set, but he teases her first.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Emilie B. Lawrence, October 4, 1875

opener.dateline:
Willet's Point,
New York Harbor,
Octr 4th 1875.

div1.p:
I have just
returned from the General's
house, where I had an
extended conversation with
him on the subject of tak-
ing a “leave-” It is unneces-
sary for me to say that it
grieves me sorely, whenever
I am compelled to disap-
point you. Believe me, my
little E., I know what it is to
be disappointed, & hence can
fully sympathize with you,
in this instance. Would that I
could break the bonds that
bind me & come to you with-
out delay. But you know I
am subject to Military Dis-
cipline, & must obey.

Perhaps, I can explain matters
somewhat. Dr Heger has not
arrived as yet- what de-
tains him is far beyond
my comprehension- Dr Byrne
has been ordered to San
Antonio, Texas & hence who
is there to attend to the sick
other than myself? Isn't it
too vexing? After I had
fully set my heart on
coming, to thus have my
plans miscarry, is enough
to make one sad forever!

However, since I have
kept you in suspense long
enough; & since Dr Byrne
will not go to Texas for
several weeks yet; and
since the General most
graciously consents, I am
happy to inform you, that
I shall leave Willet's Point
on Thursday morning, Oct.
7th & reach Murfreesboro on
Friday, sometime about noon
or soon thereafter; probably
will get there ahead of
this letter- If I do not get
to M. on Friday, you may
expect me, Saturday- I state
this, lest something should
occur to prevent me from
leaving on Thursday.

Having told you
this, need I mar the
agreeableness of my letter
by adding more?

Trusting that I may
be able able, very soon,
to “discuss” various disputed
topics with you,
div1.closer:
I remain, as ever,
your fond & devoted Walter.
P.S. Since writing the above, I find
that it is very probable that I
will not leave till Friday, & hence
arrive on Saturday- Should I not
come on the last mentioned day, ex-
pect me on Monday.
W.
